III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was provided for R. 400.4166. The agency has multiple
documents to fulfil this rule and some repeated information in these multiple
documents. It was discussed in order to have a more comprehensive
assessment at discharge the agency should streamline this process and
creating a general checklist of services that the youth may receive while in the
home or to create a document specifically bulleting this rule.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was requested or provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
I reviewed the Harbor's annual financial audit report. There are no concerns to
note.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
I reviewed the Chief Administrator Assessment. The agency did not have a CAP
for their last Interim review. The agency did have unplanned discharges due to

client self-termination and youth needing a higher level of care due to more intense
mental health care needs. The Chief Administrator reported they will continue to
monitor the needs of the youth in their care and continue to follow licensing rules.
Staff and Youth Interviews
I interviewed one staff, one supervisor and the Chief Administrator. The agency is
doing well, and no concerns were noted. The staff felt supported and appreciated
in their role. The supervisor had no issues and did well for her first audit.
One youth reported she is safe, comfortable and has been respected by all staff.
This youth had only been in the program one day.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is well maintained and has an inviting, homelike, environment. There
are no issues or safety concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
